name: Work-Based Learning (WBL) Dashboard
goal: Visualize student work-based learning (WBL) experiences in both academic and extracurricular settings. Compare outcomes between WBL and non-WBL participants to demonstrate WBL's impact. Track WBL participation trends over time, not all courses are required to have a WBL component; CTE should have a clear rationale when a WBL component is not included.
updateCycle: Summer & Fall: Dashboard in Feb – Early March
End of Year: Dashboard + Data Summary in August
distribution: Public Access: Static, publicly accessible Data Summary and Dashboard on Career Education Data, Reports, and Resources | San Diego Community College District
Email & Notifications: Sent by Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) to WBL Leads (see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → WBL tab)
highlights: Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) presented at Regional Data & Innovation Committee
Amertah Perman (aperman@sdccd.edu) and Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) presented at 2025 RP Student Success Conference
notes: Recommended College Local Customization: Department Level Summary and show courses not coded as WBL but with active enrollment

name: Handshake Reports
goal: Provide insights on student and employer engagement across SDCCD via Handshake—including account activations, job applications, job types, and employer activity.
deliverables: Downloadable Public Reports on Handshake(One-time & Upon Request)
distribution: Internal Access (Teams): SDCCD sign-in required. SharePoint files published in the Teams channel “Handshake Implementation – Districtwide Workgroup.”
Email & Notifications: Sent by Ben Jewell (bjewell@sdccd.edu) or Noah Lacsina (nlacsina@sdccd.edu) to Handshake Leads (see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → Career Services tab)
notes: Downloadable public reports on Handshake will be reviewed during the Career Services Committee meeting on February 11, 2026 and finalized in Spring 2026.

name: K16 Collaborative Grant Reporting
goal: Centralize reporting for the Regional K16 Collaborative Grant: Border Region Talent Pipeline. Focus pathways: Business, Computing, Engineering, Education, Healthcare.
distribution: Submitted on shared Googlesheets and notify Christine Jensen (christine.jensen@gcccd.edu, K-16 Collaborative Director).
Email & Notifications: Sent by Ben Jewell (bjewell@sdccd.edu) to CTE leads & College IR offices [see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → IR Offices & CTE tab]
notes: Future Planning: This report may transition to District IR Offices in 2026–2027.

name: Perkins Core Indicators Dashboard
goal: Track key performance metrics under Perkins V through an interactive dashboard disaggregated by gender, race/ethnicity, age, and program area. Supports CTE improvement planning.
dataSources: California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office - Perkins V
committeeConnections: Perkins Grant Leads and CTE leaderships
distribution: Public Access: Static, publicly accessible Data Summary and Dashboard on Career Education Data, Reports, and Resources | San Diego Community College District
Email & Notifications: Sent by Eddie Matthews (ematthews@sdccd.edu) to CTE Leads (see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → CTE tab)
highlights: Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) presented at Regional Data & Innovation Committee
Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) developed a tool that automates data download (available on PerkinsScraper). San Diego COE used the tool to replicate projects for SD & Imperial and LA regional dashboards
Amertah Perman (aperman@sdccd.edu) and Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) presented at 2024 CCCAOE Perkins Pre Conference

name: CTE Dashboard
goal: Provide foundational CTE data on student headcounts, sections, majors, and awards, comparing CTE vs non-CTE metrics and analyzing equity gaps.
distribution: Public Access: Static, publicly accessible data summaries and SDCCD sign-in–required dashboard on Career Education Data, Reports, and Resources | San Diego Community College District
Email & Notifications: Sent by Amertah Perman (aperman@sdccd.edu) to CTE Leads and IR Offices (see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → IR Offices & CTE tab)

name: Perkins Headcount Validation Dashboard
goal: Validate unduplicated CTE headcount and economically disadvantaged student counts submitted to the Chancellor's Office. Provide transparency into Section 132 formula distribution and ensure funding accuracy.
distribution: Email & Notifications: Sent by Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) to Amertah Perman (aperman@sdccd.edu) and Eddie Matthews (ematthews@sdccd.edu)
Not publicly shared but available upon request

name: SWP Projections
goal: Support Strong Workforce Program (SWP) base allocation discussions using CTE FTES and headcounts by college.
distribution: Email & Notifications: Sent by Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) to Amertah Perman (aperman@sdccd.edu) and Eddie Matthews (ematthews@sdccd.edu)
Will be used internally for SWP allocation discussions; not publicly shared

name: JPCM & WBL Regional Reporting
goal: Report Job Placement Case Manager and WBL Regional Grant data using regional definitions. Align reporting with SDCCD and regional variations.
distribution: Submitted to Kevin McMackin, kevin.mcmackin@gcccd.edu San Diego Imperial Counties Regional Consortium
Email & Notifications: Sent by Ben Jewell (bjewell@sdccd.edu) to CTE leads, Career Services Leads, and College IR offices [see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → CTE & IR Offices & Career Services tab]

name: Perkins Qualifying Criteria Dashboard
goal: Identify Perkins-eligible programs (high-wage, in-demand, high-skill) per 2024 Chancellor's Office memo.
dataSources: COE Perkins Qualifying Criteria Occupations Dashboard
distribution: Public Access: Static, publicly accessible Dashboard on Career Education Data, Reports, and Resources | San Diego Community College District
Email & Notifications: Sent by Eddie Matthew (ematthews@sdccd.edu) to Perkins Leads (see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → Perkins tab)

name: Workforce Dashboard
goal: To show how our colleges contribute to workforce development and economic mobility by aligning training programs with regional employer needs, tracking wage outcomes, and identifying skill gaps and unmet demand in priority job areas.
distribution: CTE Leads
Career Education Data, Reports, and Resources | San Diego Community College District?

name: Gainful Employment Reporting
goal: To fulfill reporting requirements under Financial Value Transparency (FVT) and Gainful Employment (GE) regulations, including enrollment, costs, and aid data submission for applicable programs.
distribution: Submitted on National Student Clearinghouse

name: Advisory committee Data Summary
goal: Provide consistent data sources for advisory committee to better understand program specific student information and labor market information.
deliverables: Data Summaries per program area per college
distribution: Public Access: Static, publicly accessible Dashboard on Career Education Data, Reports, and Resources | San Diego Community College District?
Email & Notifications: Sent by Eddie Matthew (ematthews@sdccd.edu) to Advisory Committees (TBD)

name: Perkins V Comprehensive Local Needs Assessment
goal: Support colleges completing the Perkins V CLNA by gathering and analyzing required data to evaluate CTE effectiveness and inform planning, funding, and accountability.
deliverables: Districtwide Reports: Elements 1, 2, 3, 5, 6 (Point Person: Sunny Xu, qxu@sdccd.edu)
College Reports: Elements 1, 2, 3, 5 (Point Person: Ben Jewell, bjewell@sdccd.edu)
CLNA Web Report (Point Person: Sunny Xu, qxu@sdccd.edu)
updateCycle: Provide Deliverables in Fall Odd Year (e.g. 2027)
distribution: Public Access: Static, publicly accessible web report and SDCCD sign-in–required SharePoint data summary, attached to the web report and posted on the Perkins Canvas page
Email & Notifications: Sent by Eddie Matthews (ematthews@sdccd.edu) to Perkins Leads (see CTE Research Contact List.xlsx → Perkins tab)

name: Biennial Review
goal: Support colleges meeting Education Code 78016 by providing LMI and program completion data to evaluate CTE programs.
updateCycle: Summer Odd Year(e.g. 2027) provide codes to COE
Fall Odd Year (e.g. 2027) Use the code for Biennial Review
Submit to CIC in November Odd Year (e.g. 2027)
dataSources: Program Inventory from Shelly Hess,Instructional Services shess@sdccd.edu)
distribution: Sent by Amertah Perman, aperman@sdccd.edu to CIC and CTE Leads

name: Code Alignment Project
goal: Ensure CTE programs have updated and aligned TOP-CIP-SOC Codes
updateCycle: Summer Even Year (e.g. 2026) start project planning
Fall Even Year (e.g. 2026) start auditing codes
Summer Odd Year (e.g. 2027) provide codes to COE
Fall Odd Year (e.g. 2027) Use the code for CLNA & Biennial Review
Spring Even Year (e.g. 2028) Submit CLNA & Biennial Review
dataSources: Program Inventory from Shelly Hess,Instructional Services (shess@sdccd.edu)
distribution: Codes will be reviewed by the corresponding college representatives and faculty

The crosswalk will be submitted to the San Diego Center of Excellence for Program Fact Sheets updates and to Instructional Services to ensure the changes are reflected in COCI, META, and Colleague (CS)

name: Lightcast – Skillabi
goal: Provide program and course information for Lightcast to evaluate whether programs and courses are training for skills needed in the industry.
distribution: Sent by Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) to Lightcast

name: Lightcast – Career Coach
goal: Audit active program list and SOC codes provided by Lightcast.
distribution: Sent by Sunny Xu (qxu@sdccd.edu) to Lightcast

name: EDD Data Project (2025 Projects)
goal: Provide student level data for EDD to retrieve aggregated student Post completion Employment Data for SDCCD. This data will be used in Workforce Dashboard and other CTE reports.
